column4: CORRECTED-Toronto-Dominion Bank posts higher quarterly profit
column5: Feb 26 Toronto-Dominion Bank   Canada's second-largest lender  reported a higher quarterly net profit on Thursday  helped by its retail banking business.

column4: United Airlines warns pilots after four safety incidents
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc warned its pilots last month to double down on safety procedures after one flight was in danger of crashing and another landed with fewer fuel reserves than regulations require  the airline confirmed Wednesday.

column4: Auto parts maker Visteon's revenue rises 21 percent
column5: Auto parts maker Visteon Corp  reported a nearly 21 percent rise in quarterly revenue as higher vehicle production in Asia and Europe boosted sales of its air conditioners.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-TJ Maxx raises wages  following Wal-Mart's lead (Feb. 25)
column5: Feb 25 It didn't take long for a big retailer to follow the lead of Wal-Mart Stores in raising minimum pay for workers.

column4: REFILE-South Africa's Massmart reports higher FY sales
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Feb 26 South African retailer Massmart Holdings Ltd reported a 10.4 percent jump in full-year sales on Thursday as its consumer goods  liquor and home improvement supplies business posted better performance.

column4: Ex-Wells Fargo employees to face insider trading trial  judge rules
column5: NEW YORK An administrative judge has cleared the way for U.S. regulators to take two former Wells Fargo & Co employees to trial in a closely watched case testing the limits of insider trading laws.

column4: REFILE-Whiting shares tumble on plans to keep fracking despite cheap oil
column5: WILLISTON  N.D.  Feb 26 North Dakota's largest oil producer  Whiting Petroleum Corp  struck a confident tone for 2015 on Thursday  saying it will hydraulically fracture all wells it drills even as peers scale back  but its bold tactic prompted a sharp drop in its share price.
